titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Photographs of the house at 135 Joralemon Street in Brooklyn Heights V1991.076
titlestmt.author: Finding aid prepared by Patricia Glowinski
titlestmt.sponsor: This collection was processed and described as part of the project, "Uncovering the Secrets of Brooklyn's 19th Century Past: Creation to Consolidation," funded by the Council on Library and Information Resources, with additional support from The Gladys Krieble Delmas Foundation.

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using the Archivists' Toolkit 2011-11-28T16:21-0500

did.unittitle: Photographs of the house at 135 Joralemon Street in Brooklyn Heights

physdesc.extent: six items housed in one folder.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The Photographs of the house at 135 Joralemon Street in Brooklyn Heights consist of six black-and-white photographic prints showing exterior views of the wooden-frame Federal-style house located in the Brooklyn Heights neighborhood. The photographs focus on the front porch of the house and its decorative cast-iron grillwork that dates from the mid-19th century.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Identification of item, date (if known); Photographs of the house at 135 Joralemon Street in Brooklyn Heights, V1991.076, Box number, Object ID number; Brooklyn Historical Society.

processinfo.head: Processing Information note
processinfo.p: Fully processed to the item level.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: Reproduction rights for the photographs have not been evaluated. For information on securing rights to publish or reproduce, please see the Brooklyn Historical Society Reproduction Rights Policy.

otherfindaid.head: Other Finding Aids
otherfindaid.p: Item level description and digital versions of images from the collection are available for searching via the image database in the library. Please consult library staff for more information.

bioghist.head: Historical note
bioghist.p: The two-story-plus-attic Federal-style wooden clapboard house located a 135 Joralemon Street in Brooklyn Heights was built on or before 1833. In the mid-19th century, ornamental cast iron was added to the front porch of the house. As of 2011, this house is one of the few remaining wooden houses in Brooklyn.

list.head: Sources:
list.item: Lancaster, Clay. "Joralemon Street." In Old Brooklyn Heights: New York's First Suburb. New York: Dover Publications, 1979.
Morrone, Francis. An Architectural Guidebook to Brooklyn. Layton, Utah: Gibbs Smith, 2001.
